title: President Trump Wants Greenland and Europe Says No
summary: President Trump wants the United States to buy Greenland, which is a big island owned by Denmark. He is telling European countries that if they don't let the U.S. have Greenland, he will make them pay extra taxes on things they sell to America. European leaders are meeting to decide what to do. They are sending more soldiers to Greenland to protect it and say they support Greenland staying with Denmark. President Trump is upset because he didn't win the Nobel Peace Prize, so he says he might not use only peaceful ways to get Greenland. This is causing a big argument between the U.S. and Europe.

keywords.explanation: a large island that belongs to Denmark
extra taxes on things bought from other countries
people in charge of countries in Europe
an award for people who help make peace in the world
people who protect a country in the military

questions.question: What does President Trump want to buy?
What will President Trump do if Europe doesn't let the U.S. have Greenland?
What are European leaders doing to respond?
Why is President Trump upset?
options: He didn't win the Nobel Peace Prize
questions.correct_answer: He didn't win the Nobel Peace Prize

questions.question: What are European countries sending to Greenland?

background_read: Greenland is a big island near the North Pole that is part of Denmark. Countries sometimes argue over land, and tariffs are taxes that can start trade wars. The Nobel Peace Prize is given to people who work for peace, and not winning it can make leaders angry. This article shows how leaders make decisions that affect many people.
Article_Structure: WHO: President Trump and European leaders
WHAT: Trump wants to buy Greenland and threatens tariffs if Europe says no
WHERE: Greenland, Europe, and the United States
WHY: Because Trump is upset about not winning the Nobel Peace Prize and wants control of Greenland

perspectives.description: Trump thinks getting Greenland is good for America and uses threats to try to make it happen.
Europeans want to protect Greenland and work together to say no to Trump's demands.
